@graph.caption: A white bowl with mashed potatoes and a vegetable stew on top

@graph.name: Mushroom Bourguignon - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: Serve this one-pot Mushroom Bourguignon over mashed potatoes. Made with mushrooms, red wine, and veggies, it’s ready to eat in under 1 hour.

@graph.name: Mushroom Bourguignon
@graph.description: My one-pot vegan Mushroom Bourguignon served over a bed of creamy mashed potatoes is the ultimate comfort food.
recipeIngredient: 1 Recipe Best Dang Vegan Mashed Potatoes (or serve with rice or pasta)
5  large carrots, peeled and sliced into large chunks
1 1/2 cups quality red wine (I used Pinot Noir)
1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat, then add the mushrooms and a pinch of salt. Sauté for 8-10 minutes, until browned and softened. Transfer the mushrooms to a plate nearby.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat, then add the mushrooms and a pinch of salt. Sauté for 8-10 minutes, until browned and softened. Transfer the mushrooms to a plate nearby.

recipeInstructions.text: To the pot, add another tablespoon of olive oil, along with the carrots and onions. Sauté for about 5 minutes, then add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute, until fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: To the pot, add another tablespoon of olive oil, along with the carrots and onions. Sauté for about 5 minutes, then add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute, until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the red wine and broth into the pot with the carrot/onion/garlic mixture and stir. Now add the tomato paste, thyme, oregano, salt and black pepper. Stir to combine and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the red wine and broth into the pot with the carrot/onion/garlic mixture and stir. Now add the tomato paste, thyme, oregano, salt and black pepper. Stir to combine and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a measuring cup or small bowl, stir the flour and water together, then add to the pot and stir well to thicken the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: In a measuring cup or small bowl, stir the flour and water together, then add to the pot and stir well to thicken the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked mushrooms back to the pot. Cover and simmer for 15 more minutes, until it turns into a thick stew. Stir occasionally to make sure nothing sticks to the bottom.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked mushrooms back to the pot. Cover and simmer for 15 more minutes, until it turns into a thick stew. Stir occasionally to make sure nothing sticks to the bottom.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare a batch of mashed potatoes. Spoon a generous amount of mushroom bourguignon over mashed potatoes in bowls. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare a batch of mashed potatoes. Spoon a generous amount of mushroom bourguignon over mashed potatoes in bowls. Enjoy!
